name: Alla Porta Rossa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While I respect the comments from the reviewer below, I can only disagree completelty with everything they have said. I found the staff - Orfeo and Laudina - extremely helpful and friendly. They greeted us warmly on our arrival and showed us to our fantastic apartment - Scaglie di Mare. The apartment was perfect for 2 persons - probably a push for any more unless you are very close and intimate with your friends! The view is amazing and the apartment well equipped. We cooked two nights and ate in a restaurant on another night. The whole trip was very relaxing and the Cinque Terre is stunning. Of all the towns I think Manarola is the best - small enough to be quiet and peaceful but with all the shops and restaurants you might require. Sure there are lots of steps to the apartment - but let's face it - you don't go to this part of the world for the flat terrain!!!
reviews.title: fantastico!

likes.liked: — The view from the apartment is amazing
likes.disliked: — Having to pay cash is a bit tiresome - get the credit cards working.

reviews.title: Horrible experience and I'm not alone!
reviews.text: The only thing I have to say is that payment in cash is a bit of a bore - but in way did we feel threatened or scared by Orfeo. Sure his face has lots of character - but that's his charm and that is Italy. You want bland and soulless - stay in Disneyland.

reviews.title: More Than A Slice Of Heaven!!
reviews.text: I found Orfeo very helpful - when faced with a train strike he helped us arrange a car back to Pisa so we could catch our flight. Top service all the way - and when I met Barbara in the last day she was also perfectly charming.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You simply could not find better accommodation in the Cinque Terre. SIX STARS!
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After long drive, I called the owner, Barbara, who sent her father to greet my older mother, me and my one year old son. The father made no effort to communicate in English which is fine as I can do a bit of Italian but he was a hostile, angry, in-your-face man who, frankly scared me quite a bit. He demanded cash for both nights (I didn't know they wanted that much and had 3/4 of the euros he wanted- had maxed out on my daily withdrawal from a cash machine.) Gave him all my cash and he insisted on coming back the next day at 10AM. The next morning, I saw him at about 8:30AM on the path and he practically accosted me demanding money! I walked to the nearest shop and asked them to call the police/carabinieri. Another woman there said she was also in one of "Barbara"s" apts and found the father offensive. Turns out she never met "Barbara" either who is a teacher or something(?)
reviews.title: Picture postcard

likes.liked: — Position, cleanliness and the great linen
likes.disliked: — The rooms are a little on the small side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To experience CInque Terre, we visited Manarola, one of the smaller towns and stayed at the Alla Porta Rossa Hotel for three nights. The room (Sapore di Sole) was magnificent with views of the sea from a window and from a balcony. The room was very nicely decorated, small but very comfortable, and very clean. The location was ideal - up on a hill with a lot of local people around. It was within a reasonable distance from the train station, from the Via dell'Amore - the scenic trail that connects to Riomaggiore, and close to three excellent restaurants in town. It was idyllic. Most importantly, the welcome that we received from Barbara - the owner, and the information that she provided were both great. We highly recommend this hotel if you want to enjoy a visit to a real CInque Terre town with local color, away from the bigger touristy locations.
reviews.title: Experience Cinque Terre as you should....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed in an apartment 'Scaglie di Mare' in Manarola at Álla Porta Rossa'. It was fabulous, Orfeo (dad), Grazia (mum) and Barbara were extremely friendly and helpful. The view from our large balcony was to die for. We took in some wonderful sunsets whilst sipping local wine. Manarola was gorgeous, not as big as Vernazza, Monterosso or Riomaggiore but that was it's charm. We spent 5 nights there and had a great meal at a different restaurant every night and we still did not manage to visit every restaurant! We would have breakfast by the harbour at the cafe every morning before heading out for the day. If you are going to buy souvenirs or Limoncello make your purchases in Manarola as they are actually a little cheaper than the other villages. We did all the walks/hikes except for Vernazza to Monterosso which is apparently the most challenging. The Vernazza to Corniglia is best done Corniglia to Vernazza as it is more down hill than the other direction. A word of warning! If you are arriving by train Pack Light! It is uphill to Alla Porta Rossa and if you stay in the apartment we did then it is uphill again including steps! But definitely worth it as the apartment was recently renovated, so modern and comfortable with a good balcony and a good restaurant almost next door called 'Da Billy'.
reviews.title: Great apt with fabulous view

likes.liked: — It was modern and the VIEW!
likes.disliked: — It was uphill from the harbour - a nice walk after dinner but not after a day of hiking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great stay in a double room at Alla Porta Rossa in Manarola. It was nicely finished, very clean and comfortable, with a private bath and a private balcony with a view of the sea. The family that runs the place is very friendly and warm, with a gift for hospitality. The location is above a small courtyard, away from the center of town, where one feels connected to the people and a little apart from the other tourists. The town center is easily accessible by a stairway.
reviews.title: Great Town, Great Room, Great People

likes.liked: — Private, with a view and good access
likes.disliked: — If you can't walk steps, Cinque Terre is not for you.

reviews.title: Sweeping views
reviews.text: When we returned from a long day of hiking, we were surprised to find that Orfeo and Laudina had happened to notice during check-in (from my passport) that my birthday occurred during our stay and had put some special touches on the room, wrote a birthday card, and left us a loaf of olive bread and a bottle of Persecco. We saw a lot of great sights in Italy, but receiving this kind of warmth from total strangers was definitely one of the high points of the whole trip. We would definitely stay there again and we also thought it was a great value.

reviews.title: Alla Portarossa
reviews.text: After our hike from Manarola to Monterosso, we were very glad we stayed in Manarola, finding it to be very home-like and relaxed, an ideal starting point for exploring CinqueTerre, and less "tourist-y" than some of the other towns. Ciao!

After a busy few weeks touring Great Britain and France it was great to kick back and relax at this fantastic location. There were 9 of us and we comfortably fitted into the upstairs and downstairs apartments at Alla Porta Rossa in Manarola. The place was spotless and the huge balconey a perfect spot to sit and gaze.
reviews.title: Calm Amidst the Chaos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing value for money (375 euros per night for all 9 of us) (especially compared to what we got for the same price in Paris!!) and the town is one of the least developed on the Cinque Terre, so was perfectly suited to chilling out ( we did get in quite a few walks, great stuff)
reviews.title: Scaglie di mare - As romantic as it gets!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant downstairs (La Sogliera) became a favourite, and rightly so, as the food was brilliant. Had the best cheese and tomato focaccia in nearby Corniglia, worth the climb up those 382 steps.
reviews.title: Creme Caramel - HEAVEN- many sea views!!
Marvelous Manarola
reviews.text: We will be back and have no plans to look for anywhere else to stay, it was perfect. We had every query answered promptly and no one laughed at our bumbling attempts at Italian!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A view of the vineyards, a balcony for two overlooking the sea and a central location to explore from: Alla Porta Rossa was exactly what we were looking for.
reviews.title: absolutely heaven

reviews.text: This isn't a cheap option in Cinque Terre but it served our purpose.
reviews.title: small room, partially obscured view

reviews.text: For a cheap alternative this was just fine. If you want a place that is easy to call home for a couple nights, you will wake up to a stunning view of the coast.
reviews.title: Great Room and lovely staff

description: Alla Porta Rossa in Manarola/Cinque Terre in the heart of the National Park. We can offer rooms & apartments with stunning view over the blu sea, the "little marina" with its inlet and the magic village...
